alert.note: Alert for Seneca (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 01 at 10:43PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Ohio, including the following county, Seneca. * WHEN...Until 200 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1043 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Law enforcement reports high water across numerous roads in the southern half of Seneca County including OH-162, OH-119, and CR 16. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tiffin, Bloomville, New Riegel, Attica, Republic and Bascom. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
